inclusion.criterion: Seizures persisting daily or more than 7 per week despite the appropriate use of at least 3 anti-epileptic drugs.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Known or suspected inborn error of metabolism
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Clinical suspicion of metabolic disorder as evidenced by 2 or more of the following:
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: And/ or 2 or more of the following biochemical abnormalities
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: presence of reducing sugars or ketones in urine
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: positive results on urine neurometabolic screening tests
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Motivational or psychosocial issues in the family which would preclude compliance
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Systemic illness- chronic hepatic, renal or pulmonary disease
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 41 year old man with history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, epilepsy presenting with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity. Per outside medical patient was felt to have focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth, and probably related to the atrophic changes seen on MRI, particularly in the left temporal lobe.
